action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.  
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = bloom
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: all letters in "crane" are incorrect, so I will choose a new word with entirely different letters to maximize information gain.  
guess: solid

attempts = 2
target_word = bloom
guess = solid
guess_feedback = s<red> o<yellow> l<yellow> i<red> d<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> o<yellow> l<yellow> i<red> d<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "o" and "l" are in the word but in the wrong positions, and "s," "i," and "d" are incorrect. I will choose a word that includes "o" and "l" but excludes the incorrect letters.  
guess: flour

attempts = 3
target_word = bloom
guess = flour
guess_feedback = f<red> l<green> o<green> u<red> r<red>

guess_feedback: f<red> l<green> o<green> u<red> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "l" and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "f," "u," and "r" are incorrect. I will choose a word that keeps "l" and "o" in their positions and excludes the incorrect letters.  
guess: blown

attempts = 4
target_word = bloom
guess = blown
guess_feedback = b<green> l<green> o<green> w<red> n<red>

guess_feedback: b<green> l<green> o<green> w<red> n<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "b," "l," and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "w" and "n" are incorrect. I will choose a word that keeps "b," "l," and "o" in their positions and excludes "w" and "n."  
guess: block

attempts = 5
target_word = bloom
guess = block
guess_feedback = b<green> l<green> o<green> c<red> k<red>

guess_feedback: b<green> l<green> o<green> c<red> k<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "b," "l," and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "c" and "k" are incorrect. I will choose a word that keeps "b," "l," and "o" in their positions and excludes "c" and "k."  
guess: blond

attempts = 6
target_word = bloom
guess = blond
guess_feedback = b<green> l<green> o<green> n<red> d<red>

guess_explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
all letters in "crane" are incorrect, so I will choose a new word with entirely different letters to maximize information gain.
"o" and "l" are in the word but in the wrong positions, and "s," "i," and "d" are incorrect. I will choose a word that includes "o" and "l" but excludes the incorrect letters.
"l" and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "f," "u," and "r" are incorrect. I will choose a word that keeps "l" and "o" in their positions and excludes the incorrect letters.
"b," "l," and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "w" and "n" are incorrect. I will choose a word that keeps "b," "l," and "o" in their positions and excludes "w" and "n."
"b," "l," and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "c" and "k" are incorrect. I will choose a word that keeps "b," "l," and "o" in their positions and excludes "c" and "k."
